bug.short_desc: HTMLArea as a first class form widget

long_desc.thetext:
Qooxdoo is in need of a rich text area form widget that behaves like any other form widget (data binding etc).
The Qooxdoo Form framework has grown into a very mature set of tools but it doesn't have a nicely integrated rich text area - this is something that most other GUI frameworks do have.
HTMLArea is a perfectly good fit - it just needs to be brought into the qx.ui.form package.
Another possible idea is a pluggable system that would have a default setting of the HTMLArea (other ideas may be to plug in tinymce etc so that the qooxdoo team do not need to maintain rich text editing features).
See this mailing list thread for more details -> http://qooxdoo.678.n2.nabble.com/HTMLArea-as-a-first-class-form-widget-td5512881.html#a5512881

Alex, is it it possible at all to implement the form interfaces "IForm" and "IStringForm"? Shouldn't be a bug problem, right?
Maybe moving the widget to the form package is not necessary if it just would work with the form, which should be enough.
I'll take a look at it (setting milestone to 1.3)
Discontinued support for htmlarea in the framework, set all open issues to WONTFIX. Still available as a contribution acc. to bug #7918 .
